Participants.evidence: SETTING: Laboratory data from a German University Hospital. Experiments were performed between February 2019 and September 2020.

Intervention.evidence: Four TCI pumps set to the Schnider model in effect-site mode with a target propofol concentration of 3.5 μg ml −1 were studied.

Objective.evidence: OBJECTIVE: We investigated whether differences exist in the initial bolus dose between different TCI pumps despite apparently using the same pharmacokinetic (PK) model.

Method_Outcome.evidence: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURES: Propofol bolus dose, as if delivered for anaesthesia induction.

Result_Outcome.evidence: RESULTS: A small difference in propofol bolus doses was observed for some simulations: for example, 56.4 ± 1.2 and 59.7 ± 0.2 mg with a Syramed μSP6000 and an Alaris pharmacokinetic pump, respectively, in a virtual 54-year old man with a height of 170 cm and a weight of 74 kg.
